text:
*[Bug 18664] Enable libnghttp2  in libcurl for http2 support*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18664>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|CONFIRMED                   |CLOSED

--- Comment #2 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
nghttp2 has been added and enabled in libcurl in the development version of
Rtools, including a back-port of a necessary patch to make alpn (and http/2)
work with schannel. 

nghttp2 has been added to MXE originally by Andrew Johnson, who wanted it to
become available in R. In principle, this is the best approach for anyone who
has the skill and energy, to accelerate the process of adding new features to
Rtools.

libssh2 with wincng does not support ECDSA, but a future version (1.12) is
expected to support it. I will postpone changing libssh2 setup in Rtools until
then as I am not aware of any problems with the current setup - if you have
concrete evidence about a concrete problem that cannot wait for new libss2
release, feel free to file a specific bug report.

nghttp2 has been added to MXE originally by Andrew Johnson, who wanted it to
become available in R. In principle, this is the best approach for anyone who
has the skill and energy, to accelerate the process of adding new features to
Rtools.

libssh2 with wincng does not support ECDSA, but a future version (1.12) is
expected to support it. I will postpone changing libssh2 setup in Rtools until
then as I am not aware of any problems with the current setup - if you have

release, feel free to file a specific bug report.

text:
*[Bug 18664] Enable libnghttp2  in libcurl for http2 support*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18664>

--- Comment #3 from Jeroen Ooms (<mailto:jeroenooms@gmail.com|jeroenooms@gmail.com>) ---
Would you consider using openssl then in libssh2? It seems wasteful to have two
different crypto libraries in the libcurl stack.

text:
*[Bug 18677] Documentation of base::gamma & base::is.numeric Could be Improved.*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18677>

--- Comment #11 from Jorgen Harmse (<mailto:JHarmse@roku.com|JHarmse@roku.com>) ---
That looks good as long as the documentation doesn't contradict itself. If you
say that results for x<0 are computed from the reflection formula then don't
also suggest that the integral is used for those inputs. (Don't suggest that
anyway, since the integral would diverge.) I assume that you are referring to
the fact that Gamma(x)Gamma(1-x) = pi/sin(pi x).

elements.text: [Bug 18677] Documentation of base::gamma & base::is.numeric Could be Improved.
